Instrument.name: The High Resolution Instrument (HRI) Infrared Spectrometer for Deep Impact
Instrument.description: The HRI telescope was a 30.0 cm, primary f/4.5 classical Cassegrain telescope with a dichroic beam splitter sitting in front of the telescope focal plane. Near-infrared (1-5 microns) was directed to the two-prism spectrometer. The spectrometer had an effective spatial field of view of 2.5 milliradians (0.15 degrees) and spectral field of view of view (slit width) of 10.0 microradians. Spectral resolution varied over the coverage range because of the 2-prism design. It ranged from >740 at 1.04 microns down to 210 at 2.6 microns; and then back up to 385 at 4.8 microns.
